Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • Cell

  • public class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
    Cell corresponds to a single square on the Sudoku board.
    Author:
    sjboris, alamana

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean empty
      True if the cell is empty.
      java.util.ArrayList<Group> groups
      List of groups that this cell belongs to.
      boolean[] guessArray 
      int N
      Max number of possible choices for this cell.
      int name
      Unique.
      boolean[] possibles
      True in the ith spot means that this cell could have a value of i+1.
      int size
      Number of possible values for this cell.
      int value
      Cell's value.

    • Field Detail

      • N

        public int N
        Max number of possible choices for this cell.

      • possibles

        public boolean[] possibles
        True in the ith spot means that this cell could have a value of i+1.

      • size

        public int size
        Number of possible values for this cell.

      • value

        public int value
        Cell's value. 0 means unassigned.

      • name

        public int name
        Unique. Defined as 100*row + column.

      • empty

        public boolean empty
        True if the cell is empty.

      • groups

        public java.util.ArrayList<Group> groups
        List of groups that this cell belongs to.

      • guessArray

        public boolean[] guessArray

    • Method Detail

      • adjustSize

        public void adjustSize()
        Recalculates size on every call. Size is the number the possibilities for this cell.

      • fill

        public boolean fill()
        Meant to be called when there's only 1 possible value for the cell.

      • assignValue

        public void assignValue(int n)
        Sets this cell's value to n. Backs up value. Sets size to 0. Sets empty to false.
        Parameters:
        n - The value to be assigned to this cell.

      • guessArrayFill

        public int guessArrayFill()

      • getGuess

        public int getGuess()
        Returns a guess value using the first nonzero value in possibles[]. Returns -1 if no nonzero value is found.

      • removePossibles

        public boolean removePossibles()
        Looks the value each group this cell belongs to contains and removes any values found in that group. Returns true if a change was made. False otherwise.

      • validValue

        public boolean validValue(int n)

      • removePossible

        public void removePossible(int n)
        Removes a possibility from possibles[] and adjusts size. possibles[] is zero indexed, so the value set to false will be n-1.
        Parameters:
        n - to remove from this cell's list of possible values.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Two cells are defined to be equal if they have the same name.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - Another cell
        Returns:
        true if the cells have the same name. false if they do not.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • serialize

        public java.lang.String serialize()
        Creates a string representing the cell. Format is 'value$possibles$empty$size$name$'. Possibles are separated with commas

      • resetPossibles

        public void resetPossibles()
        Sets each possibility to true.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Sets each possibility to true. Name, value, and size become 0. Empty becomes true.

      • unassign

        public void unassign()
        Resets this cell. Has it's groups recalculate values.
